DistributedDataParallel [DDP]

    • è·å¾—è¿›ç¨‹å·

    • --nproc_per_node=2æ—¶ï¼Œä¸¤ä¸ªè¿›ç¨‹çš„rankæ˜¯ä¸ä¸€æ ·çš„

torch.cuda.set_device(rank)  # é‡è¦
inputs = inputs.cuda()
if i == 0:
    # ä¸åŒçš„è¿›ç¨‹ä¼šæŠŠä¸åŒçš„æ•°æ®æ”¾åˆ°ä¸åŒçš„GPUä¸Š

    # å› æ­¤batché€Ÿåº¦ä¼šåŠ å¿«
    print(inputs.sum())  # tensor(-1578.1804, device='cuda:0'), tensor(-1578.1804, device='cuda:0')
  • main code
net = net.cuda()
net = nn.parallel.DistributedDataParallel(net)
...
trainloader = torch.utils.data.DataLoader(trainset, 
                                          batch_size=4,
                                          num_workers=2,
                                          sampler=DistributedSampler(trainset, shuffle=True))

testloader = torch.utils.data.DataLoader(testset, 
                                         batch_size=4,
                                         num_workers=2,
                                         sampler=DistributedSampler(testset, shuffle=False))
  • nproc_per_node: node
Speed CUDA LOCAL_RANK OMP node Mem% epoch Loss
7500it [00:32, 229.33it/s]*2 0,3,5,6 0 1 2 3:7-13 1 0.4727
3750it [00:17, 210.65it/s]*4 0,3,5,6 0 1 4 0,3,5,6:17-30 1 0.6264
7500it [00:32, 228.66it/s]*2 0,3 0 1 2 0,3:17-30 1 0.4878
15000it [01:00, 210.65it/s] 0,3,5,6 0 1 1 0:17-30 1 0.4165
7500it [00:32, 228.66it/s]*4 0,3,5,6 0 1 2 0,3:17-30 2 0.3774
3750it [00:25, 149.55it/s]*16 0,3,5,6 0 1 4 0,3,5,6:17-30 4 0.3563

Gpu Monitor

  • Github - NVIDIA/gpu-monitoring-tools
    • deprecated at August 2021
  • NVIDIA/dcgm-exporter
    • Repository spark star

    • Offcial Doc

      DCGM_EXPORTER_VERSION=2.1.4-2.3.1 && docker run -d --rm --gpus all    --net host --cap-add SYS_ADMIN nvcr.io/nvidia/k8s/dcgm-exporter:${DCGM_EXPORTER_VERSION}-ubuntu20.04 -f /etc/dcgm-exporter/dcp-metrics-included.csv
  • Prometheus
    • config
      - job_name: 'gpu'
    scheme: 'http'
    metrics_path: '/metrics'
    static_configs:
    - targets:
      - 'localhost:9400'
  • Grafana
    • Install
    • DashBoard import 12239

Reference

entry.title: Pytorch Gpu
entry.content:
Pytorch using GPU to training

  • Make input data and model to cuda device

    • for Model

      net = Net()
device = None
if torch.cuda.is_available():
    device = torch.device("cuda")
    net = net.to(device)

    • for data

      inputs = inputs.to(device)
labels = labels.to(device)

    • verify

      input.device  # cuda
label.device  # cuda
  • Make output data to cpu device
    • for data
    output = net(images)   # images>gpu, net>gpu, output>gpu
output = output.cpu()  # output>cpu
images = images.cpu()  # images>cpu
labels = labels.cpu()  # labels>cpu

Follow [2] to training by pytorch

Reference

  • PyTorch 20.GPUè®­ç»ƒ - ç§‘æŠ€çŒ›å…½çš„æ–‡ç«  - çŸ¥ä¹
  • VISUALIZING MODELS, DATA, AND TRAINING WITH TENSORBOARD - Pytorch
  • Convert CUDA tensor to NumPy

entry.title: The Path to Nerf
entry.content:
LLFF

  • Prepare Image
data/desk/images
â”œâ”€â”€ 2c68275866dc2b1da47f5eaf885c583.jpg

  • At LLFF project directory
nvidia-docker run --rm --env CUDA_VISIBLE_DEVICES=3 --volume /:/host --workdir /host$PWD tf_colmap bash demo.sh
  • --env CUDA_VISIBLE_DEVICES=3 is docker container env.
  • Use watch command to check which gpu is available
    • watch 'nvidia-smi | grep Default'
  • output
data/desk
â”œâ”€â”€ colmap_output.txt
â”œâ”€â”€ database.db
â”œâ”€â”€ images

â”œâ”€â”€ mpis_360
â”œâ”€â”€ outputs
â”œâ”€â”€ poses_bounds.npy
â””â”€â”€ sparse
    â””â”€â”€ 0
        â”œâ”€â”€ cameras.bin
        â”œâ”€â”€ images.bin
        â”œâ”€â”€ points3D.bin
        â””â”€â”€ project.ini

Attention

  • æ‹æ‘„çš„å›¾ç‰‡éœ€è¦æ˜¯ä¸ªçŸ©é˜µï¼Œä¸ç„¶å®¹æ˜“æŠ¥é”™
    • æŠ¥é”™ä»£ç ä¸»è¦ä½ç½®
    • llff/poses/pose_utils.py:66

Docker è¶Šæƒ

  • docker run -it --volume /:/host tf_colmap
  • change /host/etc/sudoers
  • append lihuibin ALL=(ALL:ALL) ALL below root ALL=(ALL:ALL) ALL
  • linuxä¸‹æ·»åŠ ç”¨æˆ·å¹¶èµ‹äºˆrootæƒé™

Nerf

  • issues
    • ffmpeg: Unrecognized option 'crf'. Error splitting the argument list: Option not found
      • stackoverflow
      • remove ffmpeg from conda
        • conda remove --force ffmpeg
      • install ffmpeg with apt
        • sudo apt install ffmpeg

entry.title: The Path to Nerf
entry.content:
Three tools to create citation mapping

  • 3 new tools to try for Literature mapping â€” Connected Papers, Inciteful and Litmaps - Medium
    • Connected Papers
    • Inciteful
    • LitmapsğŸ¤™
    • CoCites
      • Has chrome extension
    • Citation Gecko
      • Too simple
    • VOSviewer
      • Need data file

NeRF Path Track

  • [2Då˜3Dï¼Œè§†è§’éšæ„æ¢ï¼Œç¥è¿˜åŸé«˜æ¸…ç«‹ä½“æ„Ÿï¼Œè¿˜æ˜¯ä¸ç”¨3Då»ºæ¨¡çš„é‚£ç§ ä»£ç æ•°æ®å¼€æº - é‡å­ä½çš„æ–‡ç«  - çŸ¥ä¹](https://zhuanlan.zhihu.com/p/128554388)
  • ç™½è¯ç¥ç»è¾å°„åœºï¼ˆNeRFï¼‰ï¼šç±»ç¥ç»ç½‘è·¯åœ¨æŸ¥çœ‹ç»¼åˆçš„çƒ­é—¨æ–°æ–¹å‘ - medium

Prior

  • Volume Rendering
    • ç«‹ä½“æ¸²æŸ“ - WikiPidea
    • ä½“æ¸²æŸ“æ•°å­¦åŸç† - æ¨è¶…wantnonçš„æ–‡ç«  - çŸ¥ä¹
    • ã€è¯‘ã€‘å®æ—¶ä½“æ¸²æŸ“â€”â€”ç¬¬ä¸€ç«  ä½“æ¸²æŸ“ - Mapleçš„æ–‡ç«  - çŸ¥ä¹
      • Real-Time Volume Graphics
    • Ray tracing volume densities
  • LFR
    • Light field rendering
    • æ¼«è°ˆè®¡ç®—æ‘„å½±å­¦ (ä¸€)ï¼šç›´è§‚ç†è§£å…‰åœº(Light Field) - YE Yçš„æ–‡ç«  - çŸ¥ä¹
      • Raytrix
  • LDI
    • Layered Depth Images
  • LLFF
    • Local Light Field Fusion: Practical View Synthesis with Prescriptive Sampling Guidelines
    • Github
  • Stereo Magnification: Learning View Synthesis using Multiplane Images - Google
    • å¤šå¼ å¤šè§†è§’å›¾ç‰‡ç”ŸæˆMPI
    • Github.io
    • Multiplane Images

Future

  • MINE: Towards Continuous Depth MPI With NeRF for Novel View Synthesis - ByteDances
    • GithHub
    • [ICCV 2021 å­—èŠ‚è·³åŠ¨åˆ©ç”¨å•å¼ å›¾ç‰‡åšä¸‰ç»´é‡å»ºï¼šå°†NeRFã€MPIç»“åˆï¼Œæå‡ºMINE - ä¸çˆ±ç©çš„å°ç©å®¶çš„æ–‡ç«  - çŸ¥ä¹](https://zhuanlan.zhihu.com/p/419468401)

    • Colab

    • Github

    • Fourier Features Let Networks Learn High Frequency Functions in Low Dimensional Domains

Mesure

  • PSNR
    • Peak signal-to-noise ratio, å°–å³°ä¿¡å™ªæ¯”
  • SSIM
    • Structural similarity
    • Wikipidea

entry.title: Cmake Bug
entry.content:
Cmake can not find OpenMP

  1. Clion(2021.2.2) use the default Cmake version is 3.20.2

    1. Got following error at path-to-build/CMakeFiles/CMakeError.log

        -- The C compiler identification is MSVC 19.29.30133.0
  -- The CXX compiler identification is MSVC 19.29  30133.0
  -- Detecting C compiler ABI info
  -- Detecting C compiler ABI info - failed
  -- Check for working C compiler: C:/Program Files  (x86)/Microsoft Visual Studio/2019/BuildTools/VC  Tools/MSVC/14.29.30133/bin/Hostx64/x64/cl.exe
  -- Check for working C compiler: C:/Program Files  (x86)/Microsoft Visual Studio/2019/BuildTools/VC  Tools/MSVC/14.29.30133/bin/Hostx64/x64/cl.exe -  works
  -- Detecting C compile features
  -- Detecting C compile features - done
  -- Detecting CXX compiler ABI info
  -- Detecting CXX compiler ABI info - failed
  -- Check for working CXX compiler: C:/Program  Files (x86)/Microsoft Visual Studio/2019  BuildTools/VC/Tools/MSVC/14.29.30133/bin/Hostx64  x64/cl.exe
  -- Check for working CXX compiler: C:/Program  Files (x86)/Microsoft Visual Studio/2019  BuildTools/VC/Tools/MSVC/14.29.30133/bin/Hostx64  x64/cl.exe - works
  -- Detecting CXX compile features
  -- Detecting CXX compile features - done
  2. After a few tests, I have a status table at below, we can follow this issue
  3. Â  PC1[xps] PC2[ucas]
    clion(cmake 3.20.2) âŒ âœ…
    cmake 3.21.3 âŒ âœ…
    cmake 3.19.8 âœ…warning(CMAKE_DEPENDS_USE_COMPILER) âœ…
  4. change clion use cmake 3.19.8, the problem has gone

How to use OpenMp

  • Need some attention code at CMakeLists.txt

  • CMakeLists.txt

    FIND_PACKAGE(OpenMP)
SET(CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS "${CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS} ${OpenMP_CXX_FLAGS}")
  • Using OMP_NUM_THREADS=4 at env To Control thread num

Code, A simple example

#include <iostream>
#include <omp.h>

int main() {
    int i;
    #pragma omp parallel for private(i)
    for(i = 0;i<10;i++){
        std::cout << "Hello, World!" << i << "\t" <<omp_get_thread_num() << std::endl;
    }
    return 0;
}

Reference

  • OpenMPçš„ç®€å•ä½¿ç”¨æ•™ç¨‹ - CSDN
  • How to Compile and Run an OpenMP Program
  • OpenMPç”¨æ³•å¤§å…¨ï¼ˆä¸ªäººæ•´ç†ç‰ˆï¼‰

entry.title: Trangle Rasterization
entry.content:
OpenMVS[Homogeneous Coordinate]

  • Advanced Rasterization - Nick 2004
    • Triangle Scan Conversion using 2D Homogeneous Coordinates - CMU

Line sweeping[çº¿æ‰«æ³•]

  • Triangle-rasterization-and-back-face-culling
  • å¯¹yæ’åºï¼Œä»å·¦å‘å³è®¾ç½®åƒç´ 
  • åˆ†ä¸¤æ®µç”»å®Œ

Barycentric Coordinates[é‡å¿ƒåæ ‡ç³»åˆ¤å®šæ³• - å¹¶è¡Œè®¡ç®—ä¸­çš„åˆ¤å®š]

  • éå†AABBå†…çš„æ‰€æœ‰ç‚¹çš„é‡å¿ƒåæ ‡
  • For Convex
  • é‡å¿ƒåæ ‡å…·æœ‰ä»¿å°„ä¸å˜æ€§
  • As Area coordinates in trangle
    • å¯¹äºä¸‰ç‚¹$A,B,C$çš„åæ ‡åˆ†åˆ«ä¸º$\mathbf{a,b,c}$
    • å¯¹äºä»»æ„ç‚¹$P$çš„åæ ‡$p$
    • è®¾$S_{\triangle{PBC}}:S_{\triangle{PBC}}:S_{\triangle{PBC}}=\lambda_1:\lambda_2:\lambda_3$
    • $\lambda_1+\lambda_2+\lambda_3=1$
    • å»¶é•¿$AP$äº¤$BC$äº$D$
    • $$ \begin{aligned} &\because&BD:DC&=\lambda_3:\lambda_2\\ &\therefore& \mathbf{d}&=\frac{\lambda_2\mathbf{b}+\lambda_3\mathbf{c}}{\lambda_2+\lambda_3}\\ &\because&AP:PD&=(\lambda_2+\lambda_3):\lambda_1\\ &\therefore&\mathbf{p}&=\frac{(\lambda_2+\lambda_3)\mathbf{d}+\lambda_1\mathbf{a}}{\lambda_1+\lambda_2+\lambda_3}\\ &\therefore&\mathbf{p}&=\lambda_1\mathbf{a}+\lambda_2\mathbf{b}+\lambda_3\mathbf{c} \end{aligned} $$
    • å› æ­¤ï¼Œé‡å¿ƒåæ ‡ï¼Œ ä¹Ÿæ˜¯é¢ç§¯åæ ‡

  • For each pixel we compute its barycentric coordinates. If it has at least one negative component, then the pixel is outside of the triangle.

  • ç‚¹åœ¨ä¸‰è§’å½¢å†…çš„é—®é¢˜è½¬æ¢ä¸ºæ±‚è§£é‡å¿ƒåæ ‡
    • é¢ç§¯æ³•
      • $$ \lambda_1=\frac{S_{\triangle{PBC}}}{S_{\triangle{ABC}}}=\frac{\begin{vmatrix} 1&x_p&y_p\\ 1&x_b&y_b\\ 1&x_c&y_c\\ \end{vmatrix}}{\begin{vmatrix} 1&x_a&y_a\\ 1&x_b&y_b\\ 1&x_c&y_c\\ \end{vmatrix}} $$
      • å…¶ä¸­
      • $$ S_{\triangle_{ABC}}=\frac{1}{2}\begin{vmatrix} 1&x_a&y_a\\ 1&x_b&y_b\\ 1&x_c&y_c\\ \end{vmatrix} $$
    • ä»£æ•°æ³•
      • $$ \begin{cases} \lambda_1x_a+\lambda_2x_b+\lambda_3x_c&=x_p\\ \lambda_1y_a+\lambda_2y_b+\lambda_3y_c&=y_p\\ \lambda_1+\lambda_2+\lambda_3&=1\\ \end{cases} $$

Linear Edge Function, Line sweeping[çº¿è¾¹æ³•]

  • A parallel algorithm for polygon rasterization
    • Paper.pdf
    • ä¸»è¦æè¿°çº¿æ‰«æ³•å’Œå¹¶è¡Œè®¡ç®—ä¸­å¯¹å¤šè¾¹å½¢çš„å¡«å……è®¾è®¡
    • $$ \begin{aligned} dX_i &= X_i - X_{i-1}\\ dY_i &= Y_i - Y_{i-1}\\ E_i(X, Y) &= (X-X_i)dX_i - (Y-Y_i)dY_i \end{aligned} $$
    • å¤šè¾¹å½¢å†…ä¸ºæ­£ï¼Œå¤šè¾¹å½¢å¤–ä¸ºè´Ÿï¼Œçº¿ä¸Šä¸º0
  • Fast Spheres, Shadows, Textures, Transparencies, and Image Enhancements in Pixel-Planes
    • ä¸»è¦æè¿°ç¡¬ä»¶æ¸²æŸ“æŠ€æœ¯
